panels.description: Indicates how many acknowledgements were processed by the relayer. It can be used with `acknowledgment_events` as every event should be processed by Hermes.
panels.title: broadcast_errors_total over 1 minute

panels.description: Indicates if Hermes is submitting messages to a specific chain
panels.title: messages_submitted over 1 minute

panels.description: Indicates if you have enough funds on your wallet. Hermes can not relay without spending gas. Thus, it is important to set alarms which monitor the gas.
panels.title: Wallet balances

panels.description: Indicates if clients are getting updated.
panels.title: client_updates_submitted over 1 minute

panels.description: Indicates if you are spending gas and how much you are spending.
panels.title: Gas variation over 1 minute

panels.description: This panel indicates which type of workers are active for every instance.
panels.title: Current number of workers

panels.description: Represents the sequence number and the date of the oldest pending packet. Use this metric to identify stuck packets.
panels.title: Oldest pending packets

panels.description: Indicates how many packets are being processed by Hermes. If this value stays constantly more than 0, it could mean that a packet is stuck.
panels.title: Pending packet per path

panels.description: Indicates how many `receive_packets` were processed by Hermes. It can be used with `send_packet_events` as every `send_packet_event` should trigger the processing of a `receive_packet`.
panels.title: receive_packets_confirmed over 1 minute

panels.description: Indicates the latency rate for all transactions confirmed by each chain.
panels.title: 95th quantile of tx_latency_confirmed rate over 5 minutes

panels.description: Indicates how many `timeout_packets` were processed by the relayer. It can be used with `timeout_packet_events` as every `timeout_event` should be processed by Hermes.
panels.title: timeout_packets_confirmed over 1 minute

panels.description: Indicates how many acknowledgements were processed by the relayer. It can be used with `acknowledgment_events` as every event should be processed by Hermes.
panels.title: acknowledgment_packets_confirmed over 1 minute
What is the overall IBC status of each network?

panels.description: Indicates the number of  `send_packet_event` observed.
panels.title: send_packets_events over 1 minute

panels.description: Indicates the number of  `acknowledgement_event` observed.
panels.title: acknowledgement_events over 1 minute

panels.description: Indicates the number of  `timeout_event` observed.
panels.title: timeout_events over 1 minute

panels.description: Indicates the number of  `event` observed via the websocket subcription.
panels.title: ws_events received over 1 minute

panels.description: Indicates the number of times Hermes reconnected to the websocket.
panels.title: ws_reconnect over 1 minute

panels.description: Indicate the number of queries per instance and chain.
panels.title: RPC queries sent over 1 minute
How efficient and how secure is the IBC status on each network?

panels.description: Cleared `acknowledgment_events` rate per path. It is an indication that IBC packet relaying may be unsuccessful and that Hermes periodically finds packets to clear (i.e., unblock).
panels.title: cleared_acknowledgment_events over 1 minute

panels.description: Cleared `send_packet_events` rate per path. It is an indication that IBC packet relaying may be unsuccessful and that Hermes periodically finds packets to clear (i.e., unblock).
panels.title: cleared_send_packet_events over 1 minute

panels.description: Indicates the latency rate for all transactions submitted to each chain.
panels.title: 95th quantile of tx_latency_submitted rate over 5 minutes

panels.description: Indicates the latency rate for all transactions submitted from ibc-0
panels.title: tx_latency_submitted histogram ibc-0

panels.description: Indicates the latency rate for all transactions confirmed from ibc-0
panels.title: tx_latency_confirmed_bucket histogram ibc-0

panels.description: If `misbehaviour = true` then hermes will detect misbehaviours from clients and stop relaying to this client if one is detected. It is possible to set an alarm on this.
panels.title: client_misbehaviours_submitted over 5 minutes
